page.title: 17Melchbourne Mini-fete
page.content: The fete was organised as a fund raising event for the church. It was held on a hot Saturday in July and was attended by people from the surrounding villages as well. The venue was the beautiful garden of Hillands Cottage, nexy door to the Church. There was a variety of stalls - plants, home produce, book stall, white elephant and a bran tub, a great favourite with the children. The competitions were also excellent - apple bobbing, skittles, guess the weight of a delightful Hansel and Gretel gingerbread house cake and possibly the best of all, naming a beautiful porcelain doll dressed in blue satin and lace.(Victorian Style). Plenty of tea and cakes were consumed. The fete was enjoyed by all and raised Â£200 for the restoration fund.
